com.samysadi.acs.service.power

Interface PowerManager

  • All Superinterfaces:
    Cloneable, Entity, Notifier, Probed
    All Known Implementing Classes:

    public interface PowerManager
extends Entity
    Since:
    1.0
    Author:
    Samy Sadi , Belabbas Yagoubi

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      boolean canPowerOff(Host host)
      Returns true if the given host is not powered off and this entity authorizes to power off the given host.
      boolean canPowerOn(Host host)
      Returns true if the given host is not powered on and this entity authorizes to power on the given host.

      Creates a clone of this entity and sets its parent to null.

    • Method Detail

      • clone

        PowerManager clone()
        Description copied from interface: Entity
        Creates a clone of this entity and sets its parent to null.

        This is a deep clone method which also clones children entities and sets their parents to the newly created clone.

        Implementations must ensure that the new clone will be independent from the current entity.

        Specified by:
        clone in interface Entity
        Specified by:
        clone in interface Notifier

      • getParent

        CloudProvider getParent()
        Description copied from interface: Entity
        Returns the parent of this entity, or null if no parent is set
        Specified by:
        getParent in interface Entity
        Returns:
        the parent of this entity, or null

      • getPoweredOnHosts

        List<Host> getPoweredOnHosts()
        Returns a list of hosts that are powered on. This list includes only hosts that were powered on using current PowerManager.
        Returns:
        a list of hosts that are powered on

      • lockHost

        void lockHost(Host host)
        The power manager keeps a lock counter for each host, this method increments the lock counter which is associated with the given host.

        As long as the counter is not null, calling canPowerOn(Host) or canPowerOff(Host) will return false.

        Parameters:
        host -
        See Also:
        unlockHost(Host)

      • unlockHost

        void unlockHost(Host host)
        The power manager keeps a lock counter for each host, this method decrements the lock counter which is associated with the given host.

        As long as the counter is not null, calling canPowerOn(Host) or canPowerOff(Host) will return false.

        Parameters:
        host -
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the calling this method would result in a negative lock value for the given host
        See Also:
        lockHost(Host)

      • canPowerOn

        boolean canPowerOn(Host host)
        Returns true if the given host is not powered on and this entity authorizes to power on the given host.
        Parameters:
        host -
        Returns:
        true if and the given host is not powered on and this entity authorizes to power on the given host
        See Also:
        lockHost(Host), unlockHost(Host)

      • canPowerOff

        boolean canPowerOff(Host host)
        Returns true if the given host is not powered off and this entity authorizes to power off the given host.
        Parameters:
        host -
        Returns:
        true if the given host is not powered off and this entity authorizes to power off the given host This is usually true only if the host is not in use
        See Also:
        lockHost(Host), unlockHost(Host)

      • powerOn

        void powerOn(Host host)
        Powers on the given host.

        You should listen to appropriate notification code (CoreNotificationCodes.POWER_STATE_CHANGED) to know when the host is powered on as this may take time.

        Parameters:
        host -
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the host cannot be powered on
        See Also:
        canPowerOn(Host)

      • powerOff

        void powerOff(Host host)
        Powers off the given host.

        You should listen to appropriate notification code (CoreNotificationCodes.POWER_STATE_CHANGED) to know when the host is powered off as this may take time.

        Parameters:
        host -
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the host cannot be powered off
        See Also:
        canPowerOff(Host)
